Authors:
Guanxiu Guan, Shu-Yan Liu, Timothy Daniel Murray, Jing
Feng, Dan-Ni Jin
Title:
Morphological and multi-locus phylogeny reveals occurrence of
Golovinomyces ambrosiae on Abelmoschus esculentus from China
Keywords:
Powdery mildew; okra; Morphology; Phylogeny;
pathogenicity
Abstract:
In recent years, Golovinomyces spp. were reported on okra
(Abelmoschus esculentus, Malvaceae) from different parts of the world.
The phylogeny and taxonomy of Golovinomyces spp. on okra is evaluated
and discussed. Morphological and phylogenetic analyses revealed that
powdery mildew fungi on A. esculentus was Golovinomyces ambrosiae. A
multilocus phylogenetic examination with ITS, 28S rDNAï¼ŒIGS, and chsI
sequence data was carried out to confirm that G. spadiceus should be
allocated to G. ambrosiae with sequences data Malvaceae specimen.
Analyses of sequences from ITS determined there were G. ambrosiae and G.
bolayi within Golovinomyces were attacked okra, rather than involved
with G. cichoracearum, G. orontii in a sensu lato, and G.
spadiceus.
